channel.title: BUscience
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUscience, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A fast-moving belly flop: Researchers unveil the unique skills of cricket frogs
item.description: The way cricket frogs move across the surface of water has long been thought to resemble walking on water, but researchers have now discovered a diffe...

item.title: 'What is that?' Scientists explain white patch that appears near northern lights
item.description: A whitish, grey patch that sometimes appears in the night sky alongside the northern lights has now been explained.

item.title: X-ray flashes from a nearby supermassive black hole accelerate mysteriously

item.title: AI vs. supercomputers: New AI-based method solves complex equations faster and uses less computing power
item.description: A new artificial intelligence-based method quickly solves complex math equations used broadly across many industries — and it's faster running on a pe...

item.title: Scientists devise new method to detect permanent distortions in space-time left by massive supernova explosions
item.description: Scientists have presented a new way to detect permanent distortions in the fabric of space-time predicted to be caused by certain supernovae explosion...

item.title: Paper-based sensors may lead to rapid detection of heart attacks

item.title: Magma composition may drive volcanic tremor

item.title: 'Far out' blazar discovery suggests early universe had more supermassive black holes than previously thought

item.title: Feeding your good gut bacteria through fiber in diet may boost body against infections
